intro: Maireana proslhecochaeta, commonly known as the coastal spinifex, is a flowering plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It is a low-growing, mat-forming shrub with narrow, needle-like leaves that help reduce water loss in harsh environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Its fibrous root system allows it to thrive in sandy soils and withstand long periods of drought. Maireana proslhecochaeta plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal dunes and preventing erosion.
